text: the halfpipe is essentially a playground
where riders try to one-up each other
and no one has the bravado of Shaun
White you see the guy dropping before
you and you just get motivated you're
like well I have to destroy him his
aggressive approach allows him to get
that big air he's known for Shaun stands
alone as far as the amplitude that he
carries it starts from as high as he
possibly can in the running so that he
has maximum momentum and maximum speed
going down towards the pipe it's that
kind of feeling like you know the ball
starts rolling you're gathering momentum
in it and it really all just kind of
happens from there
the times that I'm completely happy is
when I perfectly put down my run and I
get beaten and it's probably the best
thing that can happen to me because I
get motivated I'm like okay well what's
what's he doing what's the next big
thing what do i what do I got to do from
there like I was saying I got second
place at the Olympic qualifier then the
next day I learned the double McTwist
1260 I mean there's this amazing thing I
never thought I was going to be able to
do I needed to be sure that I had the
best run out there and so I went I went
and learned it at first the double
McTwist 1260 was only at 1080 and he was
landing it backwards coming out of the
pipe a few times it over rotated to 1260
but he didn't land it cleanly and we
thought it then might become a 1260 so
he started to look in that direction
so this trick is all about the takeoff
what's interesting about the double
McTwist 1260 is that and I learned this
right off the bat that when you take off
a certain way you tend to flip the
opposite as he leaves the edge of the
pipe he's flipping forward he is also
rotating sideways that sideways rotation
brings him around so that his next flip
becomes a back flip here he can speed
things up by pulling on his grab of the
board to put yourself in that place
where you're like okay I'm doing this
whether I make it or not whether I'm
gonna be really injured or I'm gonna you
know land this or you know you don't
really know what's gonna happen and
that's a really kind of heavy thing to
do
he lands perfectly he lands high on the
wall
he immediately lands in a pump going
towards the next wall and then his
vision and his mind will switch to the
next trick and then he'll be on his way
at a high rate of speed going towards
the next law my greatest accomplishment
is to be at the top end of a sport
that's ever changing them and the
halfpipe still changing the jumps get
bigger the tricks get harder I mean I'm
inventing stuff I have to make up new
trades new moves I don't think anybody
could put as much pressure on me as I
put on myself
